1.text: Paul, servant of God, and sent of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of the chosen of God, and the acknowledgment of the truth according to devotion;

2.text: In hope of eternal life, (which God, not false, promised before eternal times;

3.text: And manifested his word in his own times, in the proclamation, which I was entrusted with according to the command of the Saviour our God;)

4.text: To Titus, genuine child according to the common faith: Grace, mercy, peace, from God the Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.

5.text: For this I left thee in Crete, that thou shouldest rectify things left behind, and set elders in the city, as I directed thee:

6.text: If any be irreproachable, the husband of one wife, having faithful children, not in accusation of licentiousness, or disorderly.

7.text: For a bishop must be irreproachable, as steward of God; not self-sufficient, not prone to anger, not intemperate, not a striker, not occupied in sordid gain.

8.text: But hospitable, a lover of good, of sound mind, just, holy, holding firm;

9.text: Holding firmly the faithful word according to instruction, that he may be able also to beseech in sound doctrine, and to refute those opposing.

10.text: For many also are disorderly, vain talkers and infatuates, especially they of the circumcision:

11.text: Who must be restrained, who subvert whole houses, teaching what they ought not, for the sake of sordid gain.

12.text: A certain of them said, their own prophet, The Cretians always liars, evil beasts, lazy bellies.

13.text: This testimony is true. For this cause reprove them severely, that they may be sound in the faith;

14.text: Not holding to Jewish fictions, and commands of men, having turned away from the truth.

15.text: All things truly pure to the pure: and to the defiled and unbelieving nothing pure; but also their mind and consciousness are defiled.

16.text: They confess to know God; and in works they deny, being abominable, and disobedient, and to every good work not tried.
